image.altText: Hard of hearing, expert on cochlear

items.synopsis: The full scope of a cochlear implant bungle is only now becoming clear, after more than 15 years of going undetected at a major public children's hospital — and there are unanswered questions about how far the ramifications might reach.

title.children: Cochlear implant bungle went undiagnosed for more than 15 years, but what happens now?

image.altText: Empty school play equipment.

items.synopsis: Police say they are aware of a number of calls and emails involving threats on schools and healthcare facilities over the past week that have escalated in the past 24 hours.

title.children: Police investigating bomb threats made to numerous SA schools

image.altText: an older man looking forward

items.synopsis: NSW upper house MPs Mark Latham and Rod Roberts announced they have resigned from One Nation and Mr Latham has tabled a letter in parliament alleging the party tried to funnel money from the NSW Electoral Commission.

title.children: Mark Latham quits One Nation, accuses party of 'defrauding NSW electoral funds'

image.altText: ABC Chair Designate Ita Buttrose.

items.synopsis: The communications minister confirms Ita Buttrose's time as chair of the ABC will end in March next year, when her term is complete.

title.children: ABC chair Ita Buttrose will not seek reappointment in 2024

image.altText: Bruce Bonyhady wearing a suit and tie and smiling.

items.synopsis: One of the original architects of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) says it is being treated as a "limitless Magic Pudding" and local, state and territory governments need to do more to support all people living with disability.

title.children: The NDIS is a 'policy miracle' but it is being treated as a 'Magic Pudding', review co-chair says

image.altText: A tall tree surrounded by fencing with mesh.

items.synopsis: The tree is in the vicinity of a controversial Victorian road upgrade, but authorities say it will not be affected by the project.

title.children: Sacred birthing tree spray-painted with words 'build the road' confirmed to have been poisoned

image.altText: A dingo walks across a beach.

items.synopsis: A wildlife expert says reducing the number of serious dingo attacks on the world heritage sand island of K'gari is going to be difficult.

title.children: 'As good as we can get it': Serious dingo attacks on K'gari prove difficult to reduce

image.altText: Leaves in the foreground with a woman sitting out of focus in the background.

items.synopsis: She thought it was a scam phone call, but it was a mother's worst nightmare, her daughter was an alleged victim of a paedophile child care worker.

title.children: When Jane discovered her daughter was the victim of alleged child abuse, she found it hard not to blame herself

image.altText: Xi Jinping raises his glass and proposes a toast while standing behind a lecturn in front of Chinese flags.

items.synopsis: For much of the past 15 years, China has been developing a weapon that now has become increasingly unstable and that threatens to detonate from within, writes business editor Ian Verrender.

title.children: Turning Japanese: Why China could be heading for a fall

image.altText: a graphic of Chinese and Taiwanese flags

items.synopsis: Ten Australian MPs are set to arrive in Taiwan late next month as part of a cross-party delegation for talks expected to largely focus on trade, with Beijing keeping a close eye on the visit.

title.children: Australian MPs preparing for trip to Taiwan, with visit to be closely watched by Beijing

image.altText: A woman wearing a black puffer jacket with long blonde hair and knee-high boots

items.synopsis: Police investigating the death of Tatiana Dokhotaru in Sydney's west release CCTV of what they allege is a phone being thrown from her unit moments after a call to triple-0 ended abruptly.

title.children: CCTV shows phone being tossed from Sydney unit hours before woman's body found

image.altText: A Russian bomber engulfed in flames at an airbase

items.synopsis: Images posted on social media show a Russian supersonic bomber engulfed in flames following a drone strike.

title.children: Ukrainian drone destroys Russian supersonic bomber

image.altText: A man in a suit looks at the camera

items.synopsis: Adam Cranston, the son of former Australian Tax Office deputy commissioner, is jailed for his role in a $105 million tax evasion conspiracy he ran with his sister and three others.

title.children: Son of former ATO deputy commissioner jailed over $105m tax evasion scheme

image.altText: An elderly woman clutches a teddy as she wears a life vest and is rescued by firefighters

items.synopsis: Southern Californians are cleaning up damage and debris after the state's first tropical storm since 1939.

title.children: Pictures capture damage and rescue efforts after Tropical Storm Hilary

image.altText: A smartphone with Facebook's logo is seen in front of displayed Facebook's new rebrand logo Meta in this illustration

items.synopsis: In sentencing a 19-year-old man for accessing child abuse material on Facebook, NT Supreme Court Justice Jenny Blokland noted "a number of similar cases before the court recently".

title.children: Meta must 'take some responsibility' for sharing of child abuse material, judge says

image.altText: A group of grey and white tanks sit side by side near a body of water.

items.synopsis: Japan's government maintains the water is safe to release, with the plan having also been approved by the UN nuclear watchdog.

title.children: Japan to begin releasing treated radioactive water from Fukushima plant in two days

image.altText: A group of men in white hazard suits, masks and yellow helmets stand beside a group of large, green-grey water tanks.

items.synopsis: The plan's opponents range from scientists who question the reasoning behind the government's actions to local fishermen who fear renewed damage to their industry's reputation.

title.children: Japan has a plan to deal with wastewater from the Fukushima nuclear plant. Here's why it's facing so much opposition

image.altText: Men's legs with rainbow socks and football boots

items.synopsis: Not a single elite male AFL player has ever come out publicly as gay or bisexual. This is what happened when Four Corners tried to ask about the silence.

title.children: We tried to tackle the AFL's last great taboo. The code got defensive

image.altText: A man in sunglasses holds a little girl in his arms at a funfair.

items.synopsis: A court hears that the brief of evidence being prepared in the prosecution of Kristen Leslie Olsen, 24, is unlikely to be completed for months.

title.children: DNA testing backlog delays case of woman accused of murdering baker and his daughter

image.altText: A smiling mother and son standing next to each other on a sunny day at a football field.

items.synopsis: Zac Dumesny was going through his best pre-season training campaign yet with his SANFL club South Adelaide when his mum urged him to see a specialist to get his persistent headaches checked.

title.children: Footy dream lives on for SANFL young gun recovering after brain tumour surgery

image.altText: A man in glasses smiles at the camera.

items.synopsis: A man allegedly told several lies to authorities after his travel companion was found dead at a Venus Bay house on the Eyre Peninsula, a South Australian Supreme Court has heard.

title.children: Murder trial witness to testify man allegedly bashed travel companion day before he was found dead

image.altText: adelaide-united-celebrate-after-making-the-a-league-finals

items.synopsis: Mount Gambier is looking to build on the momentum of the World Cup by bringing professional football to regional South Australia.

title.children: Regional SA proposes to host A-League Women's soccer match to capitalise on World Cup fever

image.altText: Stephen Gageler looks into the distance

items.synopsis: Justice Gageler, the most senior justice after Chief Justice Kiefel, will assume her role when the incumbent retires in November.

title.children: Stephen Gageler to replace Susan Kiefel as High Court chief justice

image.altText: A close shot of Brereton, who is sitting in the offices of the new national anti--corruption commission

items.synopsis: Finally a reality, the National Anti-Corruption Commission must now prove its worth. And that will be a test not of its design, nor of its powers. It will be a test of leadership, writes Linton Besser.

title.children: Will the new corruption body learn the lessons of the botched Robodebt investigation?

image.altText: Man wearing a suit looks into the camera as he walks into a room, two police officers walking in front of him

items.synopsis: Posting on his social media platform Truth Social, former US president Donald Trump says he plans to turn himself in.

title.children: Trump says he will travel to Georgia to be arrested

image.altText: A map of the world

items.synopsis: The Indian Ocean's version of El Niño — a positive Indian Ocean Dipole — typically brings a reduction in rainfall and an increase in temperatures through winter and spring.

title.children: Hot and dry weather in Australia may soon be the result of another weather event — not just El Niño

image.altText: A man in camouflage gear stands in a deserted landscape with a truck far in the background

items.synopsis: The chief of the Wagner mercenary group posts his first video address since leading a short-lived mutiny in late June, appearing in a clip possibly shot in Africa.

title.children: Wagner group's Prigozhin posts first video since mutiny, hints he's in Africa

image.altText: pink and yellow glow in the night sky, with blue glowing algae in the water

items.synopsis: Shimmering blue seas below pink and green skies are all possible in Australia's southern-most state which is a nexus for glowing oddities.

title.children: Why Tasmania is a sweet spot for glowing sea, sky and creatures

image.altText: Natural water escarpment in a national park.

items.synopsis: A search is underway for a possible missing woman near Gibraltar Falls south of Canberra after passersby reported hearing calls for help.

title.children: Passersby report hearing calls for help at closed Gibraltar Falls as search launched for possible missing woman

image.altText: Coles supermarket sign close up

items.synopsis: Woodside Energy makes a $2.7 billion profit in six months, and Coles profits are up 4.8pc, amid high inflation and cost-of-living pressures. Follow live.

title.children: Woodside Energy posts record $2.7b half-year profit, Coles profits up 4.8pc, but BHP profits down 37pc

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Circuit board software designer Altium is doing the best on the ASX 200 today after a strong end to the financial year. Altium saw revenue increase by 19 per cent to $US263.3 million ($410 million) boosted as software earnings in the US jumped by one third. After tax profit for the 2023 financial year rose by nearly one fifth to $US66.3 million ($103 million). Investors get a full year dividend of 54 cents a share. Altium chief executive Aram Mirkazemi: "Our Cloud-First Strategy is transforming our product portfolio from stand alone desktop design software to a connected cloud based design platform providing mid market customers with access to enterprise capabilities." He says Altium recently signed a significant multi-million dollar contract with global semiconductor provider Renesas Electronics Corporation. The company has also given an upbeat forecast for 2024, predicting revenue will increase by at least 20 per cent, which investors like.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Altium jumps on strong demand for cloud platforms

children.content: Circuit board software designer Altium is doing the best on the ASX 200 today after a strong end to the financial year.
Altium saw revenue increase by 19 per cent to $US263.3 million ($410 million) boosted as software earnings in the US jumped by one third.
After tax profit for the 2023 financial year rose by nearly one fifth to $US66.3 million ($103 million).
Investors get a full year dividend of 54 cents a share.
Altium chief executive Aram Mirkazemi:

"Our Cloud-First Strategy is transforming our product portfolio from stand alone desktop design software to a connected cloud based design platform providing mid market customers with access to enterprise capabilities."
He says Altium recently signed a significant multi-million dollar contract with global semiconductor provider Renesas Electronics Corporation.
The company has also given an upbeat forecast for 2024, predicting revenue will increase by at least 20 per cent, which investors like.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Australian share market is having another lacklustre day after its worst weekly performance in a year last week as investors worry about China and more possible rate rises in the US. The ASX 200 is down 0.1 per cent to 7,108 with consumer firms and energy stocks leading the sector losses. Technology stocks have rallied today after strong results from software firm Altium which saw revenue surge by 19 per cent over the year to June to $US263 million, with a 15 per cent rise in the final dividend payout. BHP (-1.5 per cent) and Coles are weighing on the market with investors disappointed with their profit results. Best and worst performers on the ASX 200: Altium +27.5% Megaport +21.75% Hub24 +15.1% Nanosonics -6.2% NIB -6.1% Coles -6%
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: ASX  in the red at midday

children.content: The Australian share market is having another lacklustre day after its worst weekly performance in a year last week as investors worry about China and more possible rate rises in the US.
The ASX 200 is down 0.1 per cent to 7,108 with consumer firms and energy stocks leading the sector losses.

Technology stocks have rallied today after strong results from software firm Altium which saw revenue surge by 19 per cent over the year to June to $US263 million, with a 15 per cent rise in the final dividend payout.
BHP (-1.5 per cent) and Coles are weighing on the market with investors disappointed with their profit results.
Best and worst performers on the ASX 200:
Altium +27.5%
Megaport +21.75%
Nanosonics -6.2%
Coles -6%

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Oil and gas producer Woodside Energy has seen half-year net profit jump to a record $US1.74 billion ($2.71 billion) after it bought BHP's petroleum business. That comes after record half-year production of 91.3 million barrels of oil equivalent, and despite a fall in oil prices. Investors get an interim dividend of $US0.80 a share, down 27 per cent from the same time last year. Woodside says development of its major growth project, Scarborough, off the north-west coast of WA, is nearly 40 per cent complete. Chief executive Meg O'Neill says Woodside is continuing to investigate the death of a worker at its North Rankin platform in June, the first fatality at an offshore platform in Australia in more than ten years. “We have implemented changes to our operational practices based on the preliminary findings of those  investigations and shared our learnings with the broader industry," Ms O'Neill said. “Woodside’s safety performance over the past two years has been below the standard we set for ourselves.  We know we must do better and are resolved to strive for a return to leading safety performance."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Woodside profit jumps to record high

children.content: Oil and gas producer Woodside Energy has seen half-year net profit jump to a record $US1.74 billion ($2.71 billion) after it bought BHP's petroleum business.
That comes after record half-year production of 91.3 million barrels of oil equivalent, and despite a fall in oil prices.
Investors get an interim dividend of $US0.80 a share, down 27 per cent from the same time last year.
Woodside says development of its major growth project,
Scarborough
, off the north-west coast of WA, is nearly 40 per cent complete.

Chief executive Meg O'Neill says Woodside is continuing to investigate the death of a worker at its North Rankin platform in June, the first fatality at an offshore platform in Australia in more than ten years.
“We have implemented changes to our operational practices based on the preliminary findings of those  investigations and shared our learnings with the broader industry," Ms O'Neill said.

“Woodside’s safety performance over the past two years has been below the standard we set for ourselves.  We know we must do better and are resolved to strive for a return to leading safety performance."

image.altText: mountain range, steep with rocks

items.synopsis: Ground and air crews are searching for two men who activated an emergency locator beacon in a remote part of the state's south-west overnight.

title.children: Rescuers yet to spot bushwalkers who set off emergency beacon in Tasmanian wilderness

image.altText: A woman laying with her baby son.

items.synopsis: Psychologists say struggling new parents are abandoning treatment as they run out of cheaper sessions. The government is being urged to up the number of subsidised sessions to 40.

title.children: 'Absolute desperation': Psychologists write to the Health Minister about the plight of new mums like Rachel

image.altText: An olde man posing with an oversized Mario figure.

items.synopsis: For the first time in the history of Nintendo's video game franchise,  a different person will be giving voice to Mario's famous sayings.

title.children: Charles Martinet, the voice of Nintendo's beloved Mario character, steps down

image.altText: A US dollar note is pictured alongside an Australian 10 dollar and 20 dollar bill.

items.synopsis: For foreign tourists? Great. For travellers? Terrible. For the economy? A mix. The fall in the Australian dollar has created winners and losers across the economy.

title.children: The Aussie dollar could slump below 60 US cents, bringing with it pain and gain

image.altText: Electricians place solar panels on roof

items.synopsis: In some cases, adding a battery to your rooftop solar system will pay off. But to be sure, households need information about many factors — and there's no single reliable place to find it, write Asma Aziz and Daryoush Habibi.

title.children: Is it worth investing in a battery for your rooftop solar? Here's what you need to know before you buy
